title: Foundation: Degree in a Relevant Field
description: A bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or Industrial Engineering provides the essential theoretical knowledge. Focus on quantitative and analytical subjects.
qualifications: BSc in Supply Chain Management/Transport & Logistics

title: Entry-Level Role: Logistics/Supply Chain Trainee
description: Start your career in an entry-level position within a specific function of the supply chain, such as procurement, warehousing, or logistics. This hands-on experience is vital for understanding the ground realities.

title: Supply Chain Analyst / Executive
description: Move into a role that involves more analysis and planning. As an analyst, you'll use data to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and forecast demand. As an executive, you'll manage specific supply chain operations.
qualifications: Professional certifications (e.g., from CILT - Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport)
institutes: All major manufacturing, retail, and logistics companies in Sri Lanka

title: Assistant Supply Chain Manager
description: Take on managerial responsibilities, overseeing a team and a significant part of the supply chain process. You will be involved in process improvement, budget management, and strategic planning for your department.
institutes: Leading apparel, FMCG, and manufacturing firms

title: Supply Chain Manager / Head of Supply Chain
description: In this senior leadership role, you are responsible for the entire end-to-end supply chain of the organization. You will develop and implement the overall supply chain strategy to meet business objectives. An MBA or a Master's in Supply Chain Management is highly beneficial.
